title: FRAMED IN DEATH
author: J.D. Robb
description: The 61st book of the In Death series. Eve Dallas investigates the murder of a woman found in the doorway of two gallery owners' home.

title: THE HALLMARKED MAN
author: Robert Galbraith
description: The eighth book in the Cormoran Strike series. A dismembered corpse found in a silver shop sets off an investigation.

title: KATABASIS
author: R.F. Kuang
description: A pair of rival graduate students descend into the underworld to save their late professor and secure his recommendation.

title: THE SURROGATE MOTHER
author: Freida McFadden
description: Abby’s personal assistant, who offers to be her surrogate, also carries an unspeakable secret.

title: BILLION-DOLLAR RANSOM
author: James Patterson and Duane Swierczynski
description: Five members of a billionaire’s family are simultaneously kidnapped.

title: SISTER WIFE
author: Christine Brown Woolley
description: Known for her appearances on the reality TV series “Sister Wives,” Woolley chronicles how she moved away from polygamy.

title: LIONS AND SCAVENGERS
author: Ben Shapiro
description: A co-founder of The Daily Wire and conservative podcast host shares his views on inequality.

title: THE ANXIOUS GENERATION
author: Jonathan Haidt
description: A co-author of “The Coddling of the American Mind” looks at the mental health impacts that a phone-based life has on children.

title: THE BODY KEEPS THE SCORE
author: Bessel van der Kolk
description: How trauma affects the body and mind, and innovative treatments for recovery.

title: CHASING EVIL
author: John Edward and Robert Hilland with Natasha Stoynoff
description: A psychic medium and a former F.B.I. agent portray their partnership.

title: TROUBLING TONSILS!
author: Aaron Reynolds. Illustrated Peter Brown
description: Charlie Marmot's infected tonsils have disappeared before surgery! (Ages 6 to 9)

title: WONDER
author: R.J. Palacio
description: A boy with a facial deformity starts school. (Ages 8 to 12)

title: HURRICANE HEIST
author: James Ponti
description: After a hurricane exposes a body from a cold case, four young sleuths investigate. (Ages 8 to 12)

title: REFUGEE
author: Alan Gratz
description: Three children in three different conflicts look for safe haven. (Ages 9 to 12)

title: IMPOSSIBLE CREATURES
author: Katherine Rundell. Illustrated Ashley Mackenzie
description: A young boy is enlisted to save a place where magical creatures reside. (Ages 10 and up)

title: HANSEL AND GRETEL
author: Stephen King. Illustrated Maurice Sendak
description: A reimagining of the classic Brothers Grimm fairy tale. (Ages 6 and up)

title: THE WONDERFUL THINGS YOU WILL BE
author: Emily Winfield Martin
description: A celebration of future possibilities. (Ages 3 to 7)

title: HOW TO CATCH A WITCH
author: Alice Walstead. Illustrated Megan Joyce
description: The Catch Club Kids attempt to snare a witch on Halloween. (Ages 4 to 7)

title: CHICKA CHICKA TRICKA TREAT
author: Julien Chung
description: The alphabet letters climb the creaky old tree for Halloween. (Ages 4 to 8)

title: ZOMBIE AND BRAIN ARE FRIENDS
author: Stephanie V.W. Lucianovic
description: Zeb the zombie and Brian the brain become friends. (Ages 4 to 8)

title: THE POWERLESS TRILOGY
author: Lauren Roberts
description: A story of forbidden love between Paedyn, an Ordinary, and Kai, an Elite, in the kingdom of Ilya. (Ages 14 and up)

title: THE SUMMER I TURNED PRETTY TRILOGY
author: Jenny Han
description: A beach house, summer love and enduring friendships. (Ages 12 and up)

title: THE HUNGER GAMES
author: Suzanne Collins
description: In a dystopia, a girl fights for survival on live TV. (Ages 12 and up)

title: HARRY POTTER
author: J.K. Rowling
description: A wizard hones his conjuring skills in the service of fighting evil. (Ages 10 and up)

title: DIARY OF A WIMPY KID
author: Jeff Kinney. Illustrated Jeff Kinney
description: The travails and challenges of adolescence. (Ages 9 to 12)

title: THORN SEASON
author: Kiera Azar
description: In the Kingdom of Daradon, where wielding magic is treason, Alissa Paine must conceal her magical abilities or face persecution. (Ages 14 and up)

title: HOUR OF THE PUMPKIN QUEEN
author: Megan Shepherd
description: After a potion demonstration goes awry, Sally and Luna fall through a portal to Time Town. (Ages 12 and up)

title: BY INVITATION ONLY
author: Alexandra Brown Chang
description: Piper and Chapin compete for Debutante of the Year at the Danse des Débutantes ball in Paris. (Ages 14 and up)

title: A THEORY OF DREAMING
author: Ava Reid
description: In the sequel to "A Study in Drowning," Effy and Preston return to the University of Llyr. (Ages 14 and up)

title: GLORIOUS RIVALS
author: Jennifer Lynn Barnes
description: The stakes are raised for the seven players on Hawthorne Island. (Ages 12 to 18)
